Hartford.Noah Webster Memorial Library (1917 buil: The 1917 Noah Webster Memorial Library building is a historic library building at 7 North Main Street in West Hartford, Connecticut. Built to a design by the Hartford firm Davis & Brooks, it is a prominent local example of Colonial Revival architecture. It housed the town library library (founded in 1897) between 1917 and 1937, and later served as a YMCA/YWCA hall and a senior center.
